starkcoder.failfast

Class AFailFast

  • java.lang.Object
    • starkcoder.failfast.AFailFast
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICheckerReference, ICallContractorReference, IFailerReference, IFailFast
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FailFast

    public abstract class AFailFast
extends Object
implements IFailFast
    Abstract implementation of IFailFast.

    The purpose of this is to ease the burden of concrete implementations.

    To extend this in a concrete implementation is optional.

    Author:
    Keld Oelykke

    • Constructor Detail

      • AFailFast

        protected AFailFast()
        Default constructor.

        After using this constructor remember to set Checker, Failer and CallContractor before use.

      • AFailFast

        protected AFailFast(IChecker checker,
         IFailer failer,
         ICallContractor callContractor)
        Recommended constructor receiving required references (manual constructor dependency injection).

        This is ready for use after this call.

        Parameters:
        checker - checker to use
        failer - failer to use
        callContractor - call contractor to use

      • getCallContractor

        public ICallContractor getCallContractor()
        Description copied from interface: ICallContractorReference
        Retrieves the call contractor. The call contractor ensures that an IChecker-call that asserts is followed by a matching IFailer-call.
        Specified by:
        getCallContractor in interface ICallContractorReference
        Returns:
        call contractor, or null.

      • setCallContractor

        public void setCallContractor(ICallContractor callContractor)
        Description copied from interface: ICallContractorReference
        Sets the call contractor, or null to end an existing contract. The call contractor ensures that an IChecker-call that asserts is followed by a matching IFailer-call.
        Specified by:
        setCallContractor in interface ICallContractorReference
        Parameters:
        callContractor - contractor to use, or null, if no contract.
